text: Tommy Bahamas is great.  I have eaten at their restaurants in Maui, Palm Desert, and here in Vegas- they are all consistently fabulous.  Service is always attentive and they have a great happy hour in the bar (there are also comfy booths if you dont want to sit at the actual bar).  Happy hour is I think from 4-7pm weekdays- discounted apps and drinks, and some really good fish tacos.  Their bread is in the shape of a crown, served hot with a sweet cinammon butter.  Great apps- favs include the coconut shrimp, cayman lollipops (chicken drumettes with mango bbq sauce), goat cheese with mango salsa and flatbread, and the ahi poke.  At lunch they have really nice salads and some great sandwiches, including a beer-battered crispy fish sandwich with tarter sauce and honey roasted onions.  For dinner, they have great seafood and a really great stuffed chicken (herb cheese and roasted red pepper cream).  Dessert here is a must, the pina colada cake is good but the butterscotch pudding is incredible.  Most desserts are available in small sizes, though they dont display this on the menu so you'll have to ask.  I highly recommend this place, especially for dinner on the patio on warm summer nights.

They have the best fish tacos!!! I love the island feel of the restaurant. It's so relaxed and they wait staff has been great each time I have gone. This is one of favorite places to eat. The Sangria is also tasty!!

YUM!  YUM-O!  Takes me back to the Florida Keys with Jimmy Buffet singing in the background....a little son of a son of a sailor rings harmoniously through my ears.

Décor is so very Florida Keys 1980 green and yellow floral, with a large amount of wicker. A perfect night for a little date!  I mean, that's what I did...maybe it's good for other occasions too :-) ...off the subject.

We sat at the bar and our server was extremely kind and attentive.  We had the poke appi and shared a fried fish sandwich (not quite Florida Keys Greg's Restaurant with the fried grouper sandwich), but oh so close.  The key lime pie was fantastic coupled with a hot cup o'joe.  

I will be back for a full dinner next...the menu looks amazing!
Love the atmosphere here, service is always good, food better than average.
Always come here for a break from gambling.  Solid food good drinks and nice atmosphere; island time.

my girlfriend and i went here last night during "island time" which is happy hour.. the place was all but empty so that was a plus... the decor is an island theme and very laid back. Our waitress was very attentive and was full of suggestions. there was a 3 course for $33 per person menu which wasn't bad at all we had a goat cheese appetizer, the "famous" coconut shrimp which were huge (delicious) and split a small Caesar salad. for an entrée we both had the island cowboy medallions.... they were cooked to perfections and were so juicy the mashed potatoes were run of the mill and the asparagus weren't tough at all... for desert i had the key lime pie which i thought was way too bitter and the coconut cake my girl had was sweet and not overrun with coconut taste.... the mai tai i had was done pretty well and the drink my girl was recommended was super strong.... only downside of the evening outside the key lime pie was we had to ask for water it wasn't just brought out with meal and the bread (which was hot and (tasty) was accompanied with apple butter we both thought that with all the sweet notes we ordered a salty one would have worked better but all in all i loved that place and i will return again

We come to Tommys often, usually for bdays, special occasions, etc, and it has become a favorite spot for us. The service is great with exceptional food. Tonight we had Naomi and she was attentive, friendly, polite and all around awesome. She even surprised us with a special anniversary dessert! She truly gave us an a memorable experience and we will be asking for her next time!

I hope the hour and half wait for the food is well worth it since we are sitting next to the kitchen door watching the group getting served as plates after plates come scrolling by.... Not even busy. 
Not much seafood options unless it's drenched in coconut...... Still  waiting still waiting. ....
The kids meal finally came. 
Waiting. ... waiting. ... that looks good! Waiting. .....
For the price of what you get and the taste, this place is not worth a second try.

With burgers being such a polarizing topic, everyone seems to think they know they best around. So naturally everyone I know constantly recommends another place in town, half of which I dismiss because they just sound awful. Such is the case with Tommy Bahama when a contractor named David I'm working with in town mentioned it. Out of all the places people throw out there, a clothing store has not been one of them and instantly sounded awful. After much persuasion, and perhaps the offer of a free meal, I caved and went with him to check it out. Could a chain known for its clothes also sport a restaurant with a VBB-worthy burger?

The restaurant is located in Town Square which can be a pain to visit at times, but also offers great people watching in the right spots.  And Tommy's definitely has a great patio outside to do just that. The inside of the restaurant looks a lot like their clothing stores with muted colors, decorative ceiling fans and pendant lights with sea shells on them. There's also a decent sized bar which is a quick way to drop in and out for a bite even when they're busy.

I can't speak much to the menu based on my visit as David knew exactly what we were ordering and placed it right away. It is available online though, and has quite a few options. The burger selected for me was the Smokehouse Angus Burger: prime Angus, toasted brioche, roasted garlic aioli, sharp white cheddar, red onion and Nueske's bacon. Upon first bite I noticed instantly that the bun was great, almost challah-like. It was soft on the outside, grilled and crispy on the inside. The top bun had a sweet ketchup spread on it, the bottom had the garlic aioli. Both spreads were minimal and just enough for flavor without being overpowering or messy. The meat had great flavor and was cooked close to my medium-rare that was ordered. The onions were fresh and not overpowering, but I still took some off as to not hijack too much of the overall flavor. The star of this burger by far was the bacon; it was crunchy, thick and had terrific flavor.

The fries weren't awful; they had good flavor and weren't oily or stale as they have often been around town lately. I wished for a bit more, but they didn't detract from the meal as a few have. As a whole I was definitely impressed with this burger, I really wasn't expecting much coming into it and got way more than expected. And although I didn't pay for this meal (thanks David!), I would say that the $13.50 menu price might be a bit steep for this. I don't know if I would include it in my Vegas 'must have' list as this is still a bit of a chain, but if you're in Town Square and looking for a good burger you should definitely stop by.
Amazing Happy Hour, the tuna is outstanding. There has never been a wait and the staff has been great.

Spur of the moment drop in for a take away lunch order. (I didn't have much time so I took a huge chance here.)

The bar was pretty empty for a Tuesday at 12:30ish. Julian the bartender was very funny & informative. After a quick peruse of the menu I decided on the HOUSE ROASTED PORK SANDWICH (bbq pulled pork) and I was quoted 10 minutes...let the timer begin!

My order arrived within the time quoted and after a 15 minutes drive to the office my lunch was still piping hot. AND DELISH!!  I've never had a piled high pulled pork as good as this one. I didn't even need to add bbq sauce as the flavor without stood on its own. Totally impressed & well worth the $13.50!

I arrived back at work on time. 

I'll be back for more of this. It was HUGE & enough for lunch AND dinner.

An okay choice for food in Town Square, but a little on the heavy side.  

Like most popular American restaurants, they cover the three essential food groups--fat, sugar and salt.  Throw in a beer, and they will be a success.

Absolutely thrilled!  Went with my my family for my son's birthday,party of 9.  We were seated immediately.  The restaurant was not busy, but everything was ready for a big crowd if needed. The hostess was smiling and pleasant, and our server Phil came right over to get us started.  Everything we were served was perfect. Steak cooked correctly....my son couldn't stop raving about the asparagus.  The manager even came over and visited with us. Thank you so much for the experience.  We will definitely be back!

Thank you to my fellow helpers for their helpful and detailed reviews!!!! The reviews prompted me to give the TB restaurant a try for my bday dinner in Vegas. We were tempted to go to some well known places on the strip but opted for TB, due to time constraints and proximity. Boy oh boy, we were so not disappointed!!!! From the first greeting to the bread to the meal, everything was fabulous. The bread with cinnamon butter was melt in your mouth yummy and the drinks were worth it. My hubs devoured the truffle-thyme salmon, I indulged in the macadamia but crusted snapper served with almond rice & asparagus, and my toddler enjoyed the chicken tenders (they were crunchy and light goodness). The servers were friendly and attentive, as my water glass never went empty. It seemed like she had a magic button on the glass or something. To top it off we even received a birthday dessert on the house!!!!  That was a complete surprise and oh so appreciated. The piña colada cake did not disappoint. It was like a melt in your mouth cake, which my hubs compared to cotton candy. The slice is so enormous that we couldn't even finish it. The linen type napkins were also an added plus along with the breath taking plantation decor & ambiance. Thank you, TB Restaurant for making my bday experience a great one. We are lookin for other locations to try next!!!

We decided to try Tommy Bahamas out for restaurant week and our experience was so-so. We arrived around 5 and were sat at a nice table by the patio. Our appetizers were delicious, I had the lobster bisque and my fiancé had the coconut shrimp. 

Unfortunately after our appetizers we waited almost another 30 minutes before our meal came out. When it did arrive, my steak and potatoes was cold. It was obvious the steak had been sitting in the window- it was sliced, dried out and almost medium well ( I ordered it medium). I have never had cold mashed potatoes at a restaurant before- I was pretty shocked. My fiancés fish was cooked perfectly and was warm, no complaints on his dish. It was more disappointing because the restaurant was not busy. 

When our server came over to collect our dirty dishes she asked if we were ready for her to put our dessert order in which explained why our dinner had come out so long after our appetizers! She didn't even ring our meals in until we were done with our appetizers! Overall our meal took two hours because of poor judgement and timing by our server. We won't be back.

The experience was perfect.  The staff and waitress was amazingly attentive.  The food was stellar.  We had the crab cakes to start, yum!! We had the anchor chili scallops and coffee rub steak, both were perfect, the scallops blew my mind! I took the pina colada cake to go, so moist and tasty.

Highly recommended!

Having just dined at Tommy Bahamas I felt the need to immediately write this review. I have been blown away by what I originally thought would be a marginal lunch but what turned out to be a fantastic experience. Our server Dominique was impeccable. Her knowledge of the menu was impressive and her recommendations were right on as well. The spicy meatball sandwich was amazing. I will definitely return and bring friends and clients to Tommy Bahamas in the future and request Dominique every time.

First time to Tommy Bahama in Vegas and I will be back.  Incredible selection of rums, as in pages if rums from around the world.  The manager came by and gave us some recommendations and we were all happy with the options we chose.

The appetizer of ahi poke was delicious, as were the coconut shrimp.  The grilled chicken and mango salad was excellent.  Perfect combo of fresh and light with a nice grilled chicken breast.  The filet and the fish tacos were very good also. 

A great, refreshing drink option was the rum with ginger beer.  A little sweet but I wanted another.  I will be a regular with the drink selections and the great food.  I'm ready to go back now!

Hello new favorite happy hour spot!! Brian,the bartender, made me the most delicious coconut cloud martini I have ever tasted! The tuna poke and blackened fish tacos are a must on the happy hour. 4-7 everyday in the bar. Self seat. Love it!!

On our way out of town, stopped here and had a wonderful lunch.  We sat outside on the patio in the absolutely perfect weather.

Service was excellent!  Our server was cheery, attentive, professional, and had a great sense of humor.

The Mai Tai drinks were phenomenal - not too sweet, the right amount of rums (perfect dark rum float), completely refreshing.

The food was very good.  Hubby had House Roasted Pork Sandwich - a huge helping of pulled pork in a blackberry brandy bbq sauce (so delicious!) on top of fresh crunchy slaw with skinny crispy fried onions piled on a toasted bun.  It was served with some of the best fries around.

I had a cup of the crab bisque, which was very tasty but really thick in consistency.  Too thick for my preference.  The Bungalow Salad, however, was fantastic.  Made with greens, dried blueberries, Feta cheese, tomatoes, pepitas, and toasted almonds and macadamia nuts in a lemony vinaigrette, it was excellent!

Just wanted to say that the service at. Tommy Bahama restraunt is TOP NOTCH! They kept my ice cream cake in their freezer, gave us plates, knife, forks to eat the cake with, doggie bag the extra pieces of cake, and washed my cake container! All that with no cake fee!!! The waitress was super nice and was not bothered by us asking her to doggie bag the cake two times.

We stopped by after movie. Something new. Not hungry enough for full meal so we shared the small plate sliders and fish tacos on the happy hour menu.  We are always looking for great artichokes. Considering they are really out of season the artichokes were not bad - great dip but a little under cooked and off the regular menu. In all with the live music, great service and food a nice end to date night! Server was Huulan and she excelled!

They looked at me funny when they brought out the pitcher of Sangri and I asked for a straw. It was a little sweet but had a great brandy kick. We stop at all of them for a pitcher and a bowl of lobster bisque. I wish I could mass produce that stuff, and in the winter I could freeze it and skate on it and then in the spring when it melts I could eat it.

Sooooooo good.
All I have to say is jerk chicken dish is on point.  Late night specials, can't beat it.  Staff is friendly.  Would recommend for the late nighters.

we were going to another restaurant ,but it had a 25 min wait so we decided to give TB a shot.  I saw the menu an wanted to leave the prices were a little high and the menu was kind of small.   We ordered the crab cakes calloway and the big island goat cheese w/ island flat bread.. First the crab cakes they were two about 2oz ea.. it was on an asian cole slaw which sat in a pool of sweet chile sauce and olive oil.
          The slaw was good but the sweet chile sauce was way too sweet, the crab cakes were meaty not to much filler and were good.
        The big island goat cheese with mac nuts and a sweet soy sauce glaze was pretty good but did not care for the island bread that came with it , more like a cracker.
          We both ordered the cuban sandwich it came with fried yucca. The sandwich was very good . It was pressed nicely so it had a nice crispness to it. The ham and roast pork was a decent amount. Everything was nicely balanced. The fried yucca was intresting it had a crisp crust and a creamy texture in the middle not much flavor like a potato. I kinda got used to it ,wife did not like it.  Service was very good. I took a star away for pricing and a small menu.  I think bahama breeze is a better deal and they have  a very diverse menu,if your looking for carribbean flavor.

Stopped by yesterday for a bite to eat and a few drinks. Sat in the bar area and ordered blackened fish tacos, coconut shrimp along with some fish and chips. The blackened fish tacos had grease dripping from them no where near blackened, the fish and chips was so greasy it was soggy, and the coconut shrimp was almost brunt. This is not the usual for this location but it has made me take them off the list until they get it together in the kitchen.

The drinks didn't fair much better. I ordered a Manhattan straight up. The most basic of cocktails and it came with foam on it. What the hell is foam doing on a Manhattan? I'm used to ice chips that dilute the drink but foam that's new.
Great atmosphere, love the food dishes, and the service was terrific! Will definitely go back again for lunch or dinner...with the girls or with couples. Love it!
Great service and surprisingly delicious chocolate cake!

We had to change our reservation to 5:30 and that was no problem.  Our friendly greeting was followed with a round of drinks in a timely manner.  Very well appointed drinks were finished along with a special asparagus soup prepared by chef Reuben.  Waitress Dominique professionally handled our orders while manager Kevin oversaw the entire dining experience.  We were treated like royalty during our meal because the way to determine if our waitress is doing a great job is by not noticing her serving the table.  The food was cooked correctly and the presentation was excellent.  Remember when the food looks good it usually tastes good.  Our food was superb.  Our salad was served on cold plates and the entree was served on hot plates.  This enabled the course to remain in the proper temperature through consumption.  We completed our meal with the piña colada cake.  It was a huge slice that we split between the four of us and we were left licking our forks.  I cannot remember a meal that was any better from the beginning to end.  Our thanks to the staff for a job well done because we will definitely return.  In the past the 3 most important words in the restaurant business was location, location, location;  but currently the 3 most important words are " I'll be back"!  And all of us agree that we will return.

My first time to a TB and was pleasantly surprised al the way around. We had a large party of 11 and our host had eaten here the week before for the first time with a large group. The apps that we ordered were all killer especially the Ahi tuna tacos, and poki.
Overall, everyone enjoyed their entrees or salads as well as the desserts. Service was great however, we had dinner on the early side.
Dinner was poor service, bad food and too expensive.  Good location for happy hour only.

The place is nice, quiet and roomy and the service is quite friendly, they gave me a free dessert on my birthday! I have no problems with the food here and my favorite item by far is the coconut shrimp which is also on the happy hour menu!

Love the food, atmosphere, singer and so many things about it...now the reason it is always empty is because the service is so frikin slow and inconsistent. It is such a shame. I just left the bar there and it took forever, again!! Come on folks, we want you to make it but you have lots of room for improvement!

I'm in love with bread they serve here... or should I say cinnamon butter they serve with bread? Either way, it's free, and I'm pretty addicted to it.

I always order chopped salad here. It's so light but fulfilling. I believe they used to serve Tomato Soup here but the last time I checked, they didn't have it :( Should I try lobster bisque?

Elected to take lunch here after shopping under the hot Nevada sun. I had a Cuban sandwich off the special lunch menu. The portions were a smaller size than standard however sufficient for most diners. Food was pleasant, nothing special and service was friendly and professional.

Hey Maan!  Dis place is great.

We were on our way out of town and saw the sign "Tommy Bahama restaurant in the town center".  I have eaten in Scottsdale, Maui, Palm Desert and was looking forward to a "leaving Las Vegas" Mai tai.

We arrived just as they opened and sat outside in beautiful weather.  I started with a Mojito , rather than the Mai Tai and boy what a fine choice I made.  I never come to these for the food, rather I love the Island theme and Caribbean music, Steele drums etc.  But this time is was not just pleasantly surprised, it was delicious.  I had the Cobb salad and substituted shrimp for chicken and my bacon well done.  It was PERFECT!!!!!!

Double your vacation and make this your first stop in and your last stop on the way out.

Ambiance              10
Food                          4
Service                    4

My husband and I eat here at least once a month as this is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.  When weather is good,  outdoor seating is perfect. It makes me feel like I'm actually on vacation!
I recommend the fish tacos or the shrimp & scallops with almond rice..both are amazing!  It is a little pricey but really worth it.  The wait staff is friendly and very accommodating. I brought my 22month old daughter and they made sure she was happy and kept checking on her to make sure she had whatever she needed to stay busy and content.

Had dinner here with my hubs and family. Service was just okay. It was super busy because of the holidays but waitress tried her best.  4 stars is for the food.  We had the lollipop chicken and the ahi tacos for appetizers it was bomb!  I had the blackened fish tacos which came with plantains on the side. It was sooooo delicious. My family was also very satisfied with the entrée they chose. We will definitely be back again.

Tommy Bahama offers the locals and tourists alike the opportunity for a freshly prepared meal, drink or snack in an Oasis setting. Bonus- the free warm bread uniquely made in 4 pull-apart peaks is served with their homemade honey-cinnamon butter (churned on their $3,000 machine)!

Pretty up-market kind of place.  The drinks and food were inventive, well-prepared and well presented.  I had the cheapest entree possible at @16.95... the blackened fish tacos which were excellent!  Next time I have the coffee-crusted ribeye steak... I can't even imagine what that'd be like.

Only place in the country I've found a "Dark and Stormy" (Ginger Beer with Dark Rum). Easy to get in the caribbean.  Tommy Bahamas makes a specialty out of its rum collection and concoctions.

We recently celebrated your 25th wedding anniversary at Tommy's in the Town Square. 

Our friends and family come from all over so our guests decided that our celebration would take place in Las Vegas. What better choice than the Marriage Capital of the World. Everything else was easy once the destination was selected. We immediately knew we were going to Tommy Bahamas.

We have been Tommy Bahama fans (both restaurant and retail) for a number of years.  We have always found the food, drinks, atmosphere and service exceptional based on our experiences in Orlando, Palm Springs, Scottsdale, Myrtle Beach and Las Vegas.   

Kaaren provided suggestions or assisted with coordinating a myriad of details including decorations, flowers, live music, menu, beverage and signature drinks, snacks, favours, and ensuring taxi services were available.

Finally our big day arrived.  We renewed our vows in the Bahama Room; adjourned to the Garden Room for champagne and hors d'oeuvres and then returned to the Bahama Room for dining and live music.

We could not have been more pleased with the success of the day.  Our guests attended from Bermuda, Prince Edward Island, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Ontario, Saskatchewan, Alberta, British Columbia, Arizona and Nevada.  All of the guests commented on the wonderful venue and ambience.

We are already planning a return trip to Tommy Bahamas Las Vegas to celebrate our 26th anniversary, but on a much smaller scale. 

We hope to visit, have a Dark and Stormy and enjoy a dining experience at each and every Tommy Bahama restaurant location as part of "Living The Life".

Our sincere thanks for a fabulous day.

Till next time,

Here for lunch. No line, no wait at all on a Wednesday afternoon. My second time at this location within the last year. It appears as though they changed up their menu a bit. Ordered the chicken lollipops (I think that's what it was called) for an appetizer and they were good. Wouldn't order again, too sweet for my liking. For my entree I had the kona coffee crusted ribeye. So good! (No taste of coffee whatsoever). Dish came with cauliflower mash and lemon arugula. The flavor was amazing! I recommend it. For dessert, I ordered their pineapple creme brûlée. Very pretty dessert & tasty! Only bad thing about lunch was I wanted a lemonade and the server said they were all out! Smh disappointed but ok...he didn't recommend anything else to drink either. But besides that, service was good. Don't forget to ask for warm bread with your meal!

I went to Tommy Bahama's with my friends from NY for New Year's and I must say- It was an amazing experience!

To start, we ordered 2 pitchers of fall sangria and goat cheese for appetizers. In addition, the chef gave us a lil amuse-bouche of chicken and potatoes as complimentary for visiting for the first time! For entrée, we shared the fish&chips, steak salad, and pork chop special. We couldn't get any desserts because we were full but our server (he was Asian but I cannot remember his name) and manager (I remember her name-- it was Emily) were both super friendly and very accommodating. I remember Emily's name because she gave us a free dessert card to use in NY! 

Despite the date when we went (which was Jan 2nd) and despite the fact that it was on a Friday night, the restaurant was not crowded at all and we could not have asked for a better experience.

AMAZING PLACE. I would highly recommend it to everyone.

We booked the private room for our wedding reception.  From the start, Kaaren was so helpful,  friendly and responsive to our ever changing head count.  Even though we arrived 25 minutes early, they quickly adjusted and our guest were promptly escorted into the room.  The buffet tables had fresh flowers that added the perfect touch.  The food was incredible! Days later our guests are still raving about coconut shrimp and Pina colada cake. Everything was so good! The drinks were amazing! No weak drinks! The 2 wait staff were friendly,  always on point and very attentive to all our guests needs and requests.  

They made this part of getting married easy,  seamless and as little stress as possible.

Highly recommended!

Came here with a bunch of friends for a concert a few months ago. We all got there right at 11AM for the 1PM show. It was kind of an oversight on the restaurant since there was a major event taking place in the middle of Town Square (right outside the restaurant) and there's apparently a rule about no competing events in the same spot. The 1PM show got moved to somewhere around 3PM or 4PM. Throughout the afternoon it was pretty hard to get any accurate info on the exact when and where of anything and where to wait, etc. Not even the band had the info to give us since the restaurant hadn't figured out all the kinks yet. We were all starving and got take out from inside the restaurant. The food was pretty good. We got a variety of items and everything tasted awesome. Once everything got going it was a bit more organized but still a bit confusing. I think the really great meal got a bit overshadowed by the unorganized event that we were all there for; I might give it another try.

If you get the chance to check out Town Square and do some shopping, Tommy Bahama's is a great place to eat lunch or dinner.  It is so nice to sit outside on the patio when the weather is nice!  Sometimes there is a band playing live music in the grassy area nearby which sets a nice atmosphere.  

We have tried:

LOKI-LOKI TUNA POKE*
Fresh Ahi Napoleon, guacamole, capers, soy and sesame oil with island flatbread $16.50 

LOVE IT!  

SABA STEAK SALAD*
Marinated, char-grilled tenderloin medallions, grilled potatoes, roma tomatoes, shiitake chips, garlic aioli & tamarind vinaigrette $17.50 

CABO FISH TACOS
Blackened white fish, blended corn & flour tortillas, pico de gallo, chipotle aioli & Asian slaw $14.00 

We were pleased with everything each time we ate here... oh and the bread with butter they bring out is awesome yummy!  :)

Made reservation for Valentines Day. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was good. Started with our absolute favorite the chicken lolly pops. We ordered their Valentines "Special" for two... 18oz prime rib and lobster (though we exchanged the lobster for chicken). It came with an amazing Gouda mac n cheese, asparagus, and herbed potato wedges.

The customer service at this store is Exemplary! From the moment you walk in the store all of your senses get stimulated. The aroma, the friendly staff who are so attentive to your every need and the GM who went above and beyond to make his customer happy!! Thank you James Williamson.... your store should be a used as a model of how great customer service makes your store just AWESOME!!!!!
This place was amazing. Took the wife and kids and we all loved our meal. It was expensive but it was worth every penny. I think good again
Happy hour great mojito coconut shrimp fish taco Cuban sandwich coconut cloud martini and great service always good times

This location is in Town Square, I think it's a hidden gem, you dont expect a restaurant inside a retail store. The ambiance is actually warm- love the candles and the fresh lilies on your table. The hostesses are super friendly and there is always a table. My favorite is the filet mignon and their cauliflower potato mash. It has a red wine mushroom reduction sauce so it makes the filet even more flavorful. Before your steak ALWAYS get the macadamia crusted goat cheese appetizer- truly mouthwatering! Their salads are stellar, their steak is unforgettable with their fried shiitake as their "crouton". Overall I love Tommy Bahama... really great steaks! Romantic for date nights as well.

Surprisingly good. Right in the heart of Town Square. Appetizers are awesome, I had the coconut shrimp, and the scallop sliders. Sliders could have been better but the shrimp was one of the best I've ever had. I had a burger (was in the mood) and it was outstanding. Cooked perfectly. Perfect beef:bun ratio, toppings were spot on. The folks I was with had the stuffed shrimp and a salmon special both of which looked  really good. This was my second time there and wasn't disappointing either time. Well done. I never want to go here, but I'm never disappointing when I do.

Excellent service. Great tasting food. We stopped here for lunch before going to the airport. It is only a mile from the car rental return so it has a great location. Restaurant is located in a local town center with lots of shops and other places to eat. 

Brandon was our server and he was so nice. Took time to explain the menu to us and even brought a complementary first course since it was our first time there. 

We had tuna tacos for an appetizer and they were amazing! Must get them!

For lunch I had the blackened fish tacos and my husband had the jerk chicken sandwich. Both were so good!

This is a place I would definitely go back to!

I just came here for dessert after a bad dinner experience at a nearby restaurant.  My friend and I shared a chocolate cake dessert and the pina colada cake dessert while sitting on the patio.

Dessert and coffee was all we had, but it was a great experience.  It felt like being on vacation at this restaurant.  The service was also great.  A little bit slow, but overall a great evening experience.  I'm definitely going back to try their lunch or dinner menu items.

Excited to have an upscale dinner tonight at Tommy Bahama ... but was greatly disappointed. The food was excellent... enjoyed their 5 Star crab cakes and lump crab avocado salad ! What was HORRIBLE was the loud live music, which was anything but tropical. We were seated as far away from the bar area as possible ... but only taking our dinner "to go" would've been the best choice. So we ate, made the best of it (because we loved the food) and left! Our terrific server ... perfect ... we let her know we loved her, the food but probably won't come back because of the music & atmosphere.

My family stopped in for our second visit to TBLV around lunch time.  I was fortunate to have manager Kevin to make us some off the menu rum concoctions!  We all had various cocktails and they were all fantastic.  Atmosphere was relaxed but attentive.  Our drinks never ran dry.  We then had a fantastic lunch in the dining room.  All the food was excellent with a great variety to choose from .  Our server Jim was great!  Took care of us as well.  This is a permanent stop for me whenever I am in Las Vegas.

I wasn't expecting the price to be so high, I came in due to curiosity because I didn't know this clothing store was also a restaurant. The bread you get with butter is flavorless and dense. I had the tuna and it was pretty good. My friend has the macadamia crusted fish and it was not good at all I wouldn't recommend ordering it. Overall it's basic food with unjustified pricing. My dish with a few pieces of tuna was $32! It was cool to try once but I would not regularly dine here.

I come here every time I come to vegas now because I love the food and the cocktails ;) the artichoke appetizer is delish and i usually ask for extra lemon aoili. I like the cant e lope drink and the pineapple martini. The ahi tuna tacos and blackened fish tacos are yummy. I've had the key lime pie, chocolate cake and pineapple creme brulee and all of them are good. They also serve this bread before your meal with a sweet butter yum. The servers are all very friendly and i feel right at home

Had a great happy hour in the bar.  The salads are good, along with the tacos.  Sip the guacamole and cream cheese dips, very strange.  Drinks are half price, service is good.  Bonus is the live music in the bar area.

I really like this place! I love their food, their Meomi, their ambiance, their patio, I just like it a lot. I've had both great, amazing experiences here and one not so hot. Overall I like this place a lot. I would recommend them to my friends and still do. The restaurant itself is located in a great area. Has a great staff, and their dishes are some of the best I've had in Town Square. Definitely check them out.
I've been here multiple times and always go here when I'm craving a Cuban sandwich. Cool atmospheres and friendly staff.

If you're willing to make the trek out here, it's fabulous! I first fell in love with the Tommy Bahama restaurant in Orlando and this one sure didn't disappoint.

Everyone in our group was really happy with their entrees. There was a chicken mango salad, crab-stuffed shrimp, coffee rubbed steak, and a chicken. I can't remember which chicken, but it was ordered at the recommendation of our server and was fabulous! We ate surprisingly little seafood, but if the crab-stuffed shrimp are any indicator of how good the seafood is - we'll need to go back for more! So yummy!

Save room for the key lime pie too!

It's also much more reasonably priced than on-strip restaurants. That's probably a no brainer, but it's nice to know. 

Also loved the service. We were the last ones in there, but never felt rushed or pressured to hurry it up.

Very fantastic restaurant in a nice shopping complex, it's right next to the Tommy Bahamas store. I was quite surprised to enjoy such a nice meal while shopping. 

We had the fish tacos and the scallop sliders both were perfect.  We also has the crab bisque which was very salty.  Would not recommend you drink as a soup but it was fantastic as a dip for the bread.  In fact the bread and the butter here were both fantastic. 

Service was great and kid friendly.  They have a kids menu with easy to digest food and a little drawing kit for kids to play with. 

I recommend it!!

Stopped by on a Sunday for a late lunch.   Atmosphere is very nice, open and airy, even in the Las Vegas heat.    I ordered the crab cake appetizer as a small portion, which they allow you to do on selected items.   It came with a wonderful asian coleslaw, and was very refreshing and delicious.   Wish I ordered the full size appetizer, it was far better than expected!

I also had the pork sandwich with blackberry brandy barbeque sauce.  It's basically a pulled pork sandwich with onion straws, and it was very good, as were the crispy fries.    The only reason that they didn't get 5 stars was due to the timing of my food.   The sandwich came out before the appetizer, so I had to ask to see if they forgot this item.   A minor issue, since this was ordered at the bar, and I'd expect table servers to be more on their game.

I had the New Belgium Ranger IPA on tap, very nice!   I didn't bother having them list all beers on tap, but this was a great option.

Overall, I will definitely be back, and would recommend this to others.

Always awesome staff in the whole restaurant, especially the bar.  I also love the live entertainment.  (Call for times)  
GM Kevin, bartenders Julian, Brian & Jennifer are super.  

Food mentioned in my previous reviews stand the same.. the most tasty & consistently fabulous.  I love the rums, wines & HH.  Chicken lollipops, Scallop sliders, Duo of Dips, Thai Shrimp & Scallops, Mahi Fish Tacos (to die for w/ the plantain side), Fish Sandwich, Stuffed Chicken Sanibel, Roasted Veggies w/ Cauliflower Steak & Chicken, Steak Salad w/ Tamarind Sauce, Pulled Pork Quesadillas, Ahi Tuna Stack, let me think... lol I guess I named more than enough.  Not only are these a few of my consistent faves, but I haven't ever been disappointed at this locations.  I once told a friend that this location was better than the one in Maui.  It truly is.  Thank you chef's for that.

What an experience!! We started by ordering the crab cakes and steak flatbread: both were super!!
We then had the ribs (melt in your mouth and that bbq sauce is yummmm), the fish tacos were also great!! 
We couldn't stop there, we had to have coffee and dessert. If you love chocolate like me, their chocolate cake with Oreo crust is the best choice, just make sure that you save enough room; the cake is super rich and it was too much for both of us.
I'm sorry, I forgot our server's name, but she was really nice and helped us with a couple choices. She really made our experience even better.
Always great food and great service. Happy hour is one of a kind and always hits all points. Just a reminder, happy hour is busy busy, so have some damn patience :)
Love the wine, the service, and the fresh food of this restaurant located at Town Square. Music is good too :)

Great restaurant. We went with a party of 6 people and everyone was happy with their food. I got a macadamia crusted fish and it was really good. I didn't get a drink but everyone else liked their mixed drinks. Our server made recommendations when asked and knew the menu and ingredients really well. I also got a fruit salad for dessert and it was on point. Lots of mango and pineapple and strawberries. I'd definitely recommend. :)

A pretty good dining experience overall.  The server was very friendly and accommodating.  The food was yummy and the cocktails were great.  The menu choices were a bit limited.  I also wanted a side of steamed veggies for my preschooler, and the only choices were asparagus and green beans.  No carrots, peas, or broccoli in a restaurant?
We here all the time. We love it. We especially like their happy hour. Their fish tacos are the best in town and the live music is always very enjoyable. We've never had a bad meal at Tommy Bahama's
The whole place was average. I thought the food was very plain and the atmosphere was not as fun as Tommy Bahama would portray.
Nice location, fun and good food. Even presented with a little something to try...Worth a trip especially if you are a Tommy Fan...

I've been here a couple of times now and realized I hadn't written a review. Probably because this is the kind of restaurant that is hard to write a review for...It's good, but not great. It has nice ambiance and good service, but nothing distinctive. It's in a good location, provided you don't mind going to Town Square. The food is good, and I like that it changes seasonally, but most of the menu is exactly what you'd expect to find at a restaurant that aims to please everyone. 

So I've been there before, and I'll go again, and I like the place. I just can't think of a reason to rave about it. Sometimes that's just what you want.

The worst service ever. 40 minutes and still haven't received our salads. Very inattentive staff. I will never done at this establishment again. Stay away if you'd like to receive your food in a timely manner. If they had negative stars I would use those.

Stopped in here for a cocktail and a quick bite to eat for lunch on a recent trip. I had the ahi tuna tacos and a dark and stormy, and my wife had a mojito. The tacos came 4 to an order, but were so delicious I could have eaten a dozen by myself! The cocktails were just perfect, a good quality rum and a bartender who really knows their stuff makes a world of difference!

I took my mother here on a Tuesday afternoon at 2pm. The place seemed to be about half full. It's very stylish and the decor isn't cramped. Relaxing, but vibrant. We grabbed a table outside as it was close to the entrance because my Mom can't walk far. Our bullish choice may have been an inconvenient location for the waitstaff. The waitress was friendly and smart but we saw her very infrequently. Not sure, but she may have been a manager picking up slack. She told us what was especially popular on the menu, but we didn't take any of her recommendations. In hindsight, I think she was steering us toward the tastier items on the menu and away from the so-so items. She mentioned that they had fresh baked bread and we told her that would be great, but it never arrived and we didn't remind her. She seemed like she was playing catch-up on those occasions when we did see her. Kindly, she did make change for a dollar as the local parking meters there only take coins and we knew right off the bat they weren't going to be able to serve us our meal within an hour. We got the coconut shrimp appetizer and it was good, but not close to the best in town. Not the largest shrimp either. One of the four was much smaller than the others. The entrees took a long time. My Mom ordered a burger and for her taste, the bun was far too soggy. It was almost wet. She would have liked it to have been toasted. I can't see how that could have been eaten without silverware. We had to ask for salt, pepper and mustard as there wasn't any available on the table. Those items came quickly though. The french fries were kind of airy and relatively free of grease. I ordered the blackberry baby back ribs and they were okay, but nothing I would order twice. It was only a half rack, which was fine, but I think the item cost about $19, which for my experience, normally gets you a full rack. There were a few birds in the area begging for food and the people seated next to us fed them a full roll on the floor near our table. We could have done without the lengthy floor show that ensued, but that's hardly the restaurant's fault. Very clean restaurant from what I could see and very nice flatware as well. Nice people.

I came to Tommy Bahama Restaurant with a large group and we enjoyed our time outside on the patio for the most part. We were here during happy hour, so we enjoyed several different appetizers and drinks that were on the happy hour menu! The drinks were delicious, and the food was great! My favorite were the blackened fish tacos.

They only honor the happy hour menu in the bar (which there wasn't enough seats for our large group) and on the patio outside. It was a nice evening in Vegas, however it was very windy! We all decided to sit outside because we wanted to take part in happy hour. The large umbrellas they had outside to give us shade were blowing everywhere, and one even fell on my friend causing her drink to spill all over her. It was a little weird because the waiter turned it on us saying that "they usually don't seat people outside when it's windy, but that they made an exception for us". Mind you, there were many other parties sitting outside at that point so it wasn't just us. The manager never came out to apologize and even if they made an exception for us, the manager still should have apologized for the incident and made sure my friend was ok. We weren't even asking for a free drink or food, just a sincere apology would have been nice! I wouldn't mind coming back here again because the food was great, but I will definitely keep the experience I had in mind next time.

Our first time here and the service was great! Very attentive,  food came out quickly.  Coconut shrimp appetizer w/ a cabbage (cilantro) slaw was deLish! Cocktails....Pineapple Paradisio Martini, classic Mojito were tasty and refreshing. I had the jerk chicken tacos (appetizer but I had as an entrée) two tacos  w a small serving of corn & black beans....yummO! 
Next time we're saving room for dessert

Overall, pretty good experience. Food was a little too sweet or salty for my taste but good nonetheless. 

I tried their prix fixe menu for Restaurant Week and got the Mahi mahi. It was a little too sweet for me - too much vinaigrette type sauce... added some lemon and it was good to go. I tried my friend's filet mignon and that was definitely good.

The peanut butter pie was like a giant reese's peanut butter cup. It was good for the first few bites but definitely too much for a full dessert. 

The service was a bit slow and probably was due to the dinner rush. I don't know if it'd be a good place to come when you're super hungry. Seating was ample though. 

Definitely worth another visit.

* update *
Just returned for a second run of their Restaurant Week deal. What I said before stands. Food tends to run a little sweet and salty. The chicken lollipop was good BUT REALLLLLY sweet/overpowered by the sauce. The filet mignon was well seasoned, but a little on the salty side. 

The food is pretty solid... and you can't really go wrong. The service this time was superb and on point. Overall win in my book.

Warm bread and wine.  The ginger nutmeg and cinnamon butter was tasty.  Mets are beating the Royals, we were off to a great start.   Then came the scallop sliders.  Perfect for a late and light dinner.  The size was just right.  Hawaiian tunes were a nice touch too!

I went to Tommy Bahama (for the first time!) with my family for dinner last week.

The thing that stood out the most was the exceptional service. Our server was extremely nice and attentive. I absolutely adored her. I'm not even kidding, I wanted to take her home with us. 

The ambiance was very nice as well. The patio was cool and comfortable; a good place to people watch. I'm not sure if I would have enjoyed eating inside as much. 

Of course, the food was excellent and the desserts are simply a must. I enjoyed the macadamia goat cheese, the crab-stuffed shrimp, and the pineapple creme brulee.

I've been to the restaurant a few times, years ago, and never had an issue. The wait staff is generally friendly and the food displaying a good spectrum of flavor. For Date Night, my wife decided to hit them up. The restaurant was dead as it was happy hour so what business there was had migrated to the Bar area with the live (but mellow) music. The Happy Hour menu is discounted, in some cases by five or six bucks, but pretty limited and with the appetizers being very scaled down versions (getting what you pay for).  Luckily, the few drinks offered are still very good. Try the "Crazy Cuban" and the "Coconut Cloud" for a sweet, boozy flavor profile! The portion sizes still waver between high-end snooty and fairly worth it though the food itself is hardly lacking. Though they no longer carry "Blackbeard's pudding", the dessert offerings are still quite delicious. If you're looking for something a little different with a relaxed atmosphere (You're already in Town Square so your wallet is expecting a dent or two), this fills that niche.

Stopped by here for lunch because we wanted to try something different, some place new. Love the look of this restaurant.  I felt I was dining at a plantation house in the Bahamas.  Which is what they are going for. The bartender actually made a delicious Martini which is a dying art. My wife and I both had Crab Bisque soup to start.  Wonderful! My wife had the coconut shrimp appetizer for her main course.  (She is nuts for coconut) She said it was some of the best coconut shrimp she has ever had. I had the bacon burger which was delicious.  The service was just fine. The waiter seem to be busy else where in the back and would show up a few moments after I was started to wonder if he'd left. But it was still decent service just a hair slower than I've experienced at other restaurants.  Give this place a try!
Pleasantly surprised by how good the food was last night.  Ahi Tuna tacos a must.  We definitely will be back.

I usually like this restaurant because the food is good but the server I had threw away my food when I asked for a box and charged me full price when I asked for happy hour fish tacos.  I won't be coming back here again!

I've always enjoyed the macadamia encrusted goat cheese, so a friend and I went to indulge on this delicious appetizer, we get seated on the patio and from that point on get ignored, a waitress passed by three times and did not even give the courtesy to acknowledge our presence, even if it was busy (which it wasn't) a quick greeting would have been suffice. We too are in the industry so it's found to be even more disrespectful. I hope this opens the eyes to the staff about giving better service because we did end up walking out.

I had lunch here last week during restaurant week with my parents, 11 month old daughter, my gf & her 2 year old son. We were seated promptly & we had the best service from Adam! He was friendly, up beat, accommodating, knowledgeable...from going out the night before & receiving horrible service at Bachi burger to receiving the best service from Adam. It was like night & day. Our drinks were always full, he helped me move chairs out of the way to fit the high chairs, our food was delivered in a timely manner. We never had to flag him down for anything. He even suggested we take our dessert to go if we were too full to enjoy at the restaurant. Thank you for being good at what you do & restoring my faith :) I'll be back!

Hubby & i went here for dinner before the JLo concert. The appetizers were great. Drinks were good. Entrees were ok, not the best but ok. Dessert flight of 3 cakes were good. I would go here again. Clean bathrooms, decent service, nice atmosphere. The courtyard outside the restaurant is beautiful at night. Fair prices.

Amazing food!  I love this place.  Anytime I am somewhere warm I actually look for a Tommy Bahama's restaurant.  The food does not get any better than this anywhere!  The drinks are stellar as well.  The price, service and ambiance make this place an exceptional location for a nice afternoon lunch with friends or even a dinner date.

As a birthday treat, my friend took me out for lunch.  I hadn't had the pleasure of dining at Tommy Bahamas so let's go!

We were greeted and seated immediately.  The dining room is open and clean.  Our waiter was right over to our table.  He was very attentive and friendly for our visit.  Drinks were always filled promptly.  

A warm complimentary bread basket is brought to the table.  The honey cinnamon butter is great.  I could eat that all day long with that bread.  But I decided to order an actual meal.  The blackened fish tacos were delicious! The fish had a great seasoning. It's filled with tomato relish, chipotle aioli, lime sour cream and Asian slaw.  So filling and so worth it.  

When they bring over the dessert sample tray, it's hard to say no.  We split the piña colada cake.  You can order the half slice or full slice.  The half slice was plenty to share.  The vanilla cake had layers of pineapple, white chocolate mousse and toasted coconut.  I loved every bite.  Next time I need to try their pineapple Creme brûlée.  It looked so tasty.  

Since it's easy to find in Town Square, I'm sure I will be dining here again.

Tommy Bahama's has a nice, relaxed and semi-formal vibe with delicious appetizers and desserts. 

My wife and I each felt our entrees were tasty, but we also felt we could make them ourselves with the right Food Network recipe! Considering each entree was in the $30 range (Ahi Tuna for me, Stuffed Chicken for her), we were disappointed overall.

So, my advice to any one pondering Tommy Bahama's for a meal, I say skip the sit-down dinner, grab a seat in the beautiful bar area, and enjoy a few rounds of appetizers and drinks.

Came in for Restaurant Week with Loren M. The $20 lunch menu features several of their best dishes, with a $30 evening/all day menu. Both seem to be a great value, with a large amount of food and several seafood options. Good spot to bring your pescatarian friend!

Caesar salad and chicken tortilla soups were solid, but the lollipop chicken and grilled artichoke apps were both very tasty with good dipping sauces. By the time we got our fish tacos, we were too full to eat them- trio of tacos with blackened fish (tialiapia?), on corn tortillas, served with plaintains and coconut cream. 

Save room for dessert- their peanut butter pie is a solid version but the Pina Colada cake is light and fresh and creamy, perfect for these hot summer temperatures! Request Phil or Pasha as your server- both are personable, attentive, and attractive!

My family and i love Friday nights here, right after work, we all come together for Happy hour which is form 5 to 7 i believe, but we usually get there at the tale end of it closer to 6:30.  The Happy hour menu has some great dishes.  My dad love the Fish tacos, and the rest of us are shrimp fans.  It can BE VERY packed on Fridays when we go.  Get there early.

I thought this place was amazing. My first time here. I felt a little under classed with how fancy some of the other customers dressed and the ambiance of the restaurant was also nice but relaxing. I had some kind of sashimi style fish taco my wife ordered and it was probably the best fish taco I've ever had and I'm from socal!  I ordered pork belly fried rice and thought it was perfect. Probably about 1 1/2 cups alone of fried rice which being Asian makes me very happy. Not stingy on the pork belly cubes either. My mojito was strong which 
 the way I like it if I'm spending that much. My waiter gave great service with no problems and was always there when i needed something and made great recommendations and gave us plenty of sauces when needed. Price wasn't too expensive considering it's town square mall. I'm definitely coming back.
Extremely slow service. Excellent venue and very cool environment but idk if the food is that food. Crab bisque is delicious. Would go again, maybe only for happy hour and appetizers

We enjoy the vibe and the food at Tommy Bahamas.  Its located at Fashion Square so the parking is kind of a pain in the butt unless you find an open spot curbside.  

There are two approaches to eating at Tommy Bahamas....Weight Gain or Weight Loss.  

If you are looking to gain weight with their delicious rich and savory menu selection, I would start by eating the bread with ginger honey butter.  If you like sandwiches, the cuban sandwich is very rich and tasty.  I also recommend the Grilled bbq spare ribs.  Decadent.  Chicken Tortilla soup is also very tasty

If you are looking to lose or maintain weight, they have a pretty decent salad selection.  Ahi tuna with Kale and mushrooms is pretty solid.  So is the grilled chicken salad.  

For those of you who are into libations, My wife loves the Grapefruit basil Martini.  Its a light drink that's not too sweet...perfect for a hot day.
Located in the center of Town Square, a convenient spot to take a break while shopping. Food are decent and staff are attentive.

Five stars to my latest experience at tommy Bahamas. Our bartender Kelly really made the afternoon perfect. She has the perfect personality for the service industry and our drinks were timely. But that's not all. This girl makes one helluva key lime martini! Our service was top notch and she handled herself like a true professional. The food was decadent, as always, and the happy hour music wasn't so loud that you couldn't hear the person next to you. I always cringe when I hear the term "live music" but this was quiet, pleasant, and even enjoyable. We will definitely be coming back for happy hour and sitting at the bar so that we can have more of Kelly's FANTASTIC martinis!
Excellent steak salad, great service, and generally the quality of food and service we've received at other Tommy Bahama Restaurant locations in Maui, Kona, and LA.

Food is great, service is awesome and the location is prime! Our host, Ron is very helpful and very enthusiastic. We ate here with my Mom and Dad who are in town from San Diego and they had a good time. With the help of Ron, coupled with his service and their delicious food, my parents had smiles of satisfaction and for a daughter, there's nothing more priceless than making your parents happy. 
I recommend this place to all who happen to be in Town Square. Worth visiting, indeed.

Great restaurant for lunch or dinner. I fell in love with their snapper dinner with rice and macadamia nuts. Probably one of the best fish dinners I ever had. May be too salty for some people but worked very well for me, especially with this fish. Reasonably priced too. My whole family enjoyed this place. While my friends come here for lunch for a reason. Nice atmosphere and great location too.

Fish Taco... You want the Blackened Fish Tacos.
I have eaten here 3 times. I'm a jerk and always get the same thing: FISH TACOS

But I have picked off other people's plates too. The steak salad is fantastic.
Service is good and we paced. It is honestly a bit pricey, but well worth it.

Also, FISH TACOS

Dear Tommy Bahammas, today I cheated on you with Ale House and paid the price....  Undercooked chicken wings, tasteless food and poor service. I learned my lesson and promise to be faithful to you and my favorite bar tenders Katie and Brian.  

Yours truly,

Loyal customer.

I really wanted to give this place more stars.  Great atmosphere good music.  They had an awesome drink selection.  The food was very good and I felt it was a bit different which was nice.  My son had the ribs and my husband had the swordfish.  We had salads which were VERY good.  I ordered a side of risotto which was so good!  Now the problem .. The service was bad!  The only time we seen our waiter was when he took our order and brought our drinks.  Our appetizer came at the same time our salad and food came.  Not once did our waiter ask if we wanted another drink.  :(. Major bummer as it could have been so much better.  I had a reservation through open table at 4:30 so it was slow.  I would try again.. Maybe just a fluke!  Enjoy!!

Slow service during lunch on a recent friday while sitting in the bar area. Bartender was overwhelmed and the manager had to come out to take orders and help refill beverages. We waited close to 20 minutes from sitting down to having our order taken, and then 15 minutes after putting our order in we were informed the kitchen was busy and backed up and we would be waiting a little longer since out order was still 4 more to go. 
I had the fish sandwich and it was very good, but the bun was so soggy that it kept falling apart and I had to eat the sandwich with a knife and fork.
I was here for a private party for Tommy Bahama retailers- cool bar and drinks were good.  Nice atmosphere!  The spread they offered was amazing!

Chicken lollipops are the bomb.com.  Went with my daughter and everything was great.  The kona coffee crusted rib eye was decent with the warm potato salad.  Didn't care for the bread pudding but my little one loved it.  Good lunch while shopping at Town Square, love the beachy  feel.

Amazing food and good prices too, I get salmon salad was boom and the Cuban sandwich is boom to. I really love this place thanks . La comida muy bueno y los precios razonables , yo comí una ensalada de salmón súper rica y el sándwich cubano es uno de los mejores q he comido . Muchas gracias al mesero q nos atendió .

Great atmosphere, great service and good food! 

We started with the goat cheese and bacon jam crostini (yum, yum and yum). I would've liked a little more goat cheese and less bacon jam, but I enjoyed it.

I ordered the lump crab and avocado salad as my entree, which I really liked, except for the capers and onions which seemed strangely out of place. They didn't skimp on the crab, so I felt like it was hearty even though it was a salad.

If you've read any of my other reviews, you'd see I like a good bread basket. The bread here is served warm and with a cinnamon butter that pairs perfectly with it.

Their mango iced tea is also really good, especially during the summer! Because of the heat I can't handle sitting outside, but on a nice day, their patio is a nice spot to relax and people watch.

Tommy Bahama is a good Caribbean-themed bistro with fresh dishes and bright flavors.  It's a little on the corporate side with it's ambiance, but the menu has a number of strong dishes.  

I'll admit that walking in the place, I was a little dubious.  The restaurant houses one side of the building and the other side of the building sells tacky J. Crew-style Caribbean clothing.  Doesn't really sound like the best place to find a meal.  But after a few dishes, I was won over.  

The tortilla soup was a huge winner with bright, fresh flavors and a nice spice.  Not over-the-top spiciness, but just enough to bring out the chicken and tomato flavors.

Coconut shrimp came across as fairly standard.  Not a real stand out dish, but I was impressed with the freshness of the shrimp.  

Also had the Jerk Chicken.  To put it simply, it was perfectly cooked, tender, and nice balance of sweet and tangy.

I'm not the biggest fan of the atmosphere--a bit too much corporate in this bistro for me--but the flavors were very good and the dishes all fresh.  Thumbs up.

Food was good but not as hot as I'd like fish, rice and asparagus to be.  Good flavor and service.  Enjoyed a specialty drink. A little pricey. Unusual dessert looks.  Nice number of food choices.  Spicey butter was appreciated. Extra touches.

Dined here for restaurant week 2018 with my friend Jessie and my 19 month old son. They immediately brought my kiddo a kids menu with crayons and a working high chair! Our server Pascha was very friendly. We both ordered drinks from the bar and then looked over the menu. We chose this spot because they had two lunch menus, a $20 and a $30 with 3 courses; appetizer, soup/salad, and entree.

I went with the $20 menu and got the grilled artichoke, caesar salad and cuban sandwich. I had a hard time choosing between the sandwich or the tacos so I asked Pascha to surprise me. I really thought he would bring the tacos, especially since I over heard him tell another table they are a best selling item, but whatever. The grilled artichoke was delicious. It was grilled and had garlic butter and parmesan cheese on it, and it came with a yummy lemon tarragon aioli dipping sauce. I would definitely order it again. The salad was your typical ceasar salad, except instead of chopped lettuce it was lettuce leafs. The Cuban sandwich was okay, but really I think I would have preferred the tacos. It came with their island coleslaw and jerk yucca fries which were spicy! To drink I had the Kona Brewing Hula Hefewiezen which was yummy. Tasted a bit like Blue Moon but not as fruity. We also were brought warm bread and honey butter with our meals.

Finally it was time for desert. This was not included with the restaurant week special but it was $5 and I can't ever pass up dessert. I chose the pb pie and it was delicious! The crust was salted pretzel - yum. The pie tasted like a salty peanut butter cup. 

I have to mention I ordered my son the $7 chicken fingers with fruit and asked for ranch instead of honey mustard and the waiter said they don't have ranch. What?!!? I've never heard of such a thing. So fellow ranch lovers, take note! The chicken fingers were crispy and yummy and came with a side of fresh fruit. The boy was very happy as he gobbled most of it up.

I love restaurant week because it gives me a chance to try places I otherwise would not have. This is one of those places. I would for sure come back for a meal here.

The General Manager of Tommy Bahama Restaurants contacted me a couple of days after our experience.  We are dining at Tommy Bahama's Las Vegas Restaurant tonight.  I will certainly update my post.  Looking forward to a great dinner experience.
We ate at Tommy Bahama's 
It's always a good idea to give a restaurant a second chance.  We returned to Tommy Bahama's in TS.  We started with Happy Hour in the bar.  Fast, friendly service.  Well organized and staffed appropriately.  We had perfectly prepared martinis.
Bryan, a manager, spoke with us.  He is a friendly personable person.
We were seated on time.  The hostess took note of my request, (My husband is deaf). To be seated in a quieter area of the restaurant. Not that this restaurant is extremely noisy.  We had a very friendly, experienced waitress, Joanie.  Our wine was delivered promptly, by Dominica.  I think Dominica might be a manager.  Dominica was friendly, and knowledgeable.  Our food was prepared to perfection, and served hot. 
We loved our dining experience.  Everything couldn't have been better.

Yum!   Dinned on the Patio last nite,  was very impressed with the Chicken Lollipop appetizers, and  the Bread.......  oh my goodness it was was Soooo good,  the server gave us extra to take home .  The Caesar salad with Chicken perfect.   Will definitely  be back soon
Being from out of town this place really is a great place the service was fantastic and food is excellent, will be stopping here every trip here and will recommend to all our friends.

Actually, this is one of the loveliest places for our family in Vegas. We usually come for Sunday brunch. Always have pleasant service and delicious food. I adore design and place is usually not crowded or loud. Good for families with kids, perfect for a date. And...desserts are...fantastic!

Excellent establishment! Great team that works here that ensures every guest feels valued. I'd recommend this place for any occasion. They also have one of the best happy hours in town. Great for business meetings or date night.

This has been, by far, the best restaurant experience of our trip to Las Vegas. The food was excellent, the drinks were phenomenal, and our waiter, Anthony, was the absolute best! His suggestions were on point and he took care of us from the second we sat down. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Sin City!
The service is awesome and food is delicious. I love the chill vibe and island theme. Reminds me of Boca Ratón Fl lols ...but serious I totally dig it

Mediocore, okay, nothing significant about this place.

Tried out their happy hour cause my friend was fiending alcohol and cheap food. Well, the alcohol and food were cheap but it's small portions. Don't get too excited. 

Ordered ahi poke, madamia goat cheese, sliders and fish tacos. Seriously, after sharing those with my friend, I was still hungry. There are other happy hours in town where they serve a larger portion.

Also ordered a mojito and margarita. Eh, it's aiiiiggght.
Food quality and presentation was good. Prices are kind of high in comparison to food portions. Ask for outside seating if weather permits. Will be back when in immediate area.

It gets BUSY at Happy Hour! So be a nice, little, patient guest and understand that the staff is running their a***es off and will get to you as soon as they can. 

The live music was really fun and different. I loved the large selection on happy hour and as a first timer, I had a blast and will definitely be back :) Katie, our bartender, recommended the fish tacos and the goat cheese apps on happy hour. I got those! Yum! The regular guy next to me also ordered the blackened fish tacos and gave them high praise and a thumbs up to me in my wise ordering. My gf and I had a couple cocktails and personalized shots and we were then definitely inducted into the cool club. Lol. We went upstairs to Blue Martini for ladie's night, BUT I wish I had just stayed and chilled at Tommy Bahamas!!!!!Better service, more fun, delicious food, and a chill atmosphere at Tommy Bahama's I will tell everyone btw! It's a Town Square hidden gem.But, if you'd like to be carded a million times, pay more for watered down stupid martini and "extra" shaker drinks (BM) drinks, go to Yard House or Blue Martini. haha! Enjoy my photos and more to come!

Hubby surprised me by taking me here for my birthday last week.  He had very specific parameters within which to work: 1) the restaurant had to be close to UNLV because I had to get back that night for a rehearsal, 2) the restaurant had to have good yelp reviews!, and 3) the restaurant HAD to have chocolate cake on the dessert menu (because I like cake and because it's my birthday!).  He found Tommy Bahama's, made a reservation just in case, and picked me up at the uni.  

What a lovely dinner!  The food was FANTASTIC.  Service was almost flawless; waitstaff forgot to bring our grilled artichoke appetizer before our main dishes.....BUT they comped the appetizer to make up for that oversight and gave me 3 free desserts because it was my birthday!  

Our dinner began with the bread basket and honey/cinnamon/garlic butter.  Warm, soft, crusty bread with sweet butter.  What's not to like?  The grilled artichoke was decadent and delicious.  For our mains, we both ordered fish: I had the the seared ahi tuna (YUM) and hubby had the black cod (again, YUM).  Portions were not huge; rather, they were "normal" sized and allowed us the stomach space to have a multi-course meal.  Desserts were perfect.  The chocolate cake was rich and velvety and indulgent, the key lime pie featured fabulous bright flavours that contrasted with the graham crust, and the pina colada cake was just plain good.  The waitstaff even sang "Happy Birthday" to me whilst bringing out my desserts.  How cute!

All in all, I never would have thought that a retail clothing store would house a hidden dining gem.  Would I come again?  Most definitely.  Thanks for a GREAT birthday meal, Tommy!  :)

My parents held a reception/lunch there after their vow renewal.  The private room was so nice and bright.  The gal we worked with  (can't remember her name) was so nice and easy to work with.  The food was good.  They were super accommodating about setting up and doing a slide show and the cake.  Very reasonably priced for Vegas and great location at Town Square, close to the park so the grandkids got to run around and play after.  Highly reccmomended

Our favorite waitress Becky told us to visit her at Tommy Bahama's for a great happy hour and amazing food. We finally went into the restaurant tonight not sure what to expect. First of all, we definitely under estimated the size of the space. The restaurant is much bigger than it looks from the outside and is a generally nice space. They had live music playing in the bar that you can hear throughout the dining room and the atmosphere was sort of romantic but still comfortable. We were very happy with the ambience.

We were happy that Becky was working tonight to help guide us through the menu. She convinced us to be adventurous with our food choices and I'm so glad she did. Without her I wouldn't have known how delicious Yucca fries are! I tried new things and even the simplest things, like my chicken sandwich were well above average. My only regret is that I wish I saved room for desert because those looked just as amazing as the food was! 

If you have walked past this restaurant with curiosity like we have, I strongly recommend that you check it out. The flavors are so deliciously different than any other restaurant and definitely a place you'll want to visit again!

A true fine dining experience.  Rob, the manager, and our server Dominique provided and excellence service.  This was my first time at a Tommy Bahama restaurant as I didn't even know they were in the food industry.  I was truly amazed by both the service and the food.  I had the crab bisque and Thai shrimp and scallops, both were delicious.  One of the best meals I've ever eaten!

Finally went for Happy Hour and it is now one of my favs! The closest you can probably get to feeling like your on vacay when you can't be.  The perfect weather did make such the difference. We had a table for 5 outside and it was perfect! The drink and menu options are great!  A small menu but a very good mix if things.

First round of drinks I had the sangria which the flower in it just gave it that little extra something to make you feel like you were on a tropical island somewhere...it's the little things!  2nd round was the basil martini which was delicious.  The drinks were good and reasonably priced.  I would have had more if I wasn't driving :)

Food was really good! My favorite was the macadamia goat cheese! Fish tacos and plantain chips were yummy too. I plan to go back and get the poke and the sliders, which others in my party said the sliders were really good, I was just too full! But always have room for dessert and when they brought out the dessert tray, had to try the creme brûlée in the pineapple.  Not only was it pretty and tropical looking but was amazing!  Never had that mix, glad we did and will definitely get it again!  We scraped the bottom!

I wouldn't have minded sitting inside because the guitar player Justin is amazing! I didn't realize he played there but saw him one day when I was passing through the restaurant.  He happen to be the musician I got to play at my sisters wedding. I saw him at a friends wedding and had to book him.  So glad I know where I can catch him play!

Town Square has many great happy hour options! This is up there in the rankings for sure! Such a great deal for the food and drinks you are getting!  Service is great and the outdoor patio is awesome for those perfect weather Vegas evenings!

When in Vegas there are many party spots to visit. There are few places at which you can combine a cas and classy atmosphere, buying awesome clothes and having a perfect blue cheese stuffed olive Martini. This is it.

Came for our first time. Loved the crusted goat cheese. Then we shared the grilled Cobb salad with this amazing blue cheese dressing. Then our entree was the blackened fish tacos which we will be back for. Tried the pineapple mojito..which I'm sure some people would like but I didn't..but luckily Katey came to the rescue and made me a blood orange Margarita that was to die for. The pineapple creme Brule..which I'm pretty sure they killed someone for the recipe. We will definitely be back..but only when Katey is working since she can really make a drink and hold a good conversation.

This is our go to place at town square. The food is fantastic and the staff has been great every time. They seem like friends who remember what we like. I've been here about 50 times.
I usually sit in the bar area where they have live music on some evenings.
The regular dining area is also very nice. Makes you feel like you're in the Bahamas.
There's even an outside area that I belive is the nicest in all of town square.
I love the fish tacos, chicken lollipops, and just about everything else on the menu.

You can never go wrong with Tommy Bahamas! 

This is our 3rd time here and it was on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. You MUST always get the Sangria, the red one. OMG its the best! 

I always get something different every time we go there, but everything is good like to die for. 

This is also a MUST try.

Love this place so much. I came for Restaurant week. It's was such a great deal for $20... I got an amazing tortilla soup, it was soooooo good. It's a must have. So much flavor. Then I got the Blackened fish tacos, one of my favorites at Tommy Bahamas. We got 3 tacos and on the side we got plantains with a pineapple dipping sauce with crusted coconut shavings! Wow! Then our 3rd course was a sampler of dessert chocolate cake, coconut cake and lemon meringue... Yummy! Ok so I am a big fan of Tommy Bahamas I have never been disappointed on anything that I've ordered there. 
Oh and my drink at Tommy Bahama is a Mai Tai also a must try. 
After all this knowing that I had a great lunch for restaurant week also felt good Tommy Bahama will be donating to three square!

Super-cute little place, open, airy feel. Great decor. So tropically classy!
A local friend of mine took me here for lunch as she also wanted to show me the awesome shopping area it is in. We skipped over a super fancy place and chose this one - fancy in its own right but 'Florida-feel casual' at the same time.
Our waiter was really sweet - we got several wait staff helping us throughout our meal, actually. Some things took awhile like our waters and my coffee but overall, I liked our experience. 
I tried the chicken tortilla soup which was excellent and served hot. YUM! Little bits of sweet corn came on top. My friend had ordered an appie and a main and I knew that would be a lot for me for lunch but what the hell - I also got the blackened fish tacos. They were good - of course they do not compare to say, some you would get in Hawaii but they were quite tasty. I could only eat 1 out of 3 of them. Also on the side of the plate in addition to a lime, you get a little pineapple yogurt type dessert in a taco shell with beautifully fried plantains on top. OMG, I left full and of course I took my tacos with me!
My friend loved her lobster bisque as well as her chicken tacos and she too had a to-go bag!
My one comment would be that we had asked for all the dishes to come at one time but my soup came first and nothing else. Not even my friend's soup came so I felt a bit bad eating alone for a bit. But we said nothing and tipped very well.
Would love to go back next time I am in town, maybe for dinner sometime to see the mood of the restaurant at night.

Ask for Anthony!

We brought my parents here to celebrate my father's birthday earlier this week and we had a lovely dining experience all around. 

I should be talking about the food but, service first. We LOVED our server ANTHONY...he is AMAZING! Seriously, we dine out a lot and get a lot of sub par service.
